address.description: The address in bech32 encoding. It can be the address of the smart contract that generated the log or the address of the receiver address of the transaction.
The address in bech32 encoding. It can be the address of the smart contract that generated the event or the address of the receiver address of the transaction.

data.description: The data field can contain information added by the smart contract that generated the event.

topics.description: A list with extra information. They don't have a specific order because the smart contract is free to log anything that could be helpful.

order.description: The index of the event indicating the execution order.

originalTxHash.description: The hash of the initial transaction.

timestamp.description: The timestamp of the block in which the log was generated.
